DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course Central Nervous System Radiation Therapy Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: For lung and leukemia cases only, codes for radiation given to the brain or central nervous system.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment First Course Central Nervous System Radiation Therapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Radiation given to the brain or central nervous system. Includes treatment given at all facilities as part of the first course.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: The main information-processing organs of the nervous system, consisting of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: Central Nervous System Radiation Therapy Number Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges._Emission or propagation of electromagnetic energy (waves/rays), or the waves/rays themselves; a stream of electromagnetic particles (electrons, neutrons, protons, alpha particles) or a mixture of these. The most common source is the sun._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.A system of numbered categories for representation of data.__A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unknown (for lung and leukemia only); Not Applicable (for primaries other than lung and leukemia)
The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.

Concepts.definition: The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No radiation to the brain and/or central nervous system

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No radiation to the brain and/or central nervous system
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No radiation to the brain and/or central nervous system

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Central Nervous System radiation Therapy Number Code
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The main information-processing organs of the nervous system, consisting of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.:Emission or propagation of electromagnetic energy (waves/rays), or the waves/rays themselves; a stream of electromagnetic particles (electrons, neutrons, protons, alpha particles) or a mixture of these. The most common source is the sun.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Emission or propagation of electromagnetic energy (waves/rays), or the waves/rays themselves; a stream of electromagnetic particles (electrons, neutrons, protons, alpha particles) or a mixture of these. The most common source is the sun.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

AlternateNames.name: Radiation to the Brain and/or Central Nervous System (SEER)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR, V 11.1 Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 11.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (5/4/06)

ReferenceDocuments.name: RX Summ-RAD to CNS Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: Includes treatment given at all facilities as part of the first course. See Chapter V, Unresolved Issues, for more information. SEER does not collect this data item beginning with 1998 cases. They retain the codes for older cases in this field, and they have also recoded radiation coded here as radiation in RX Summ--Radiation [1360].  COC does not collect this data item beginning with 1996 cases.
